title: On a conjecture of Tuza about packing and covering of triangles
main_result: tau* = nu* by LP duality; Tuza for K_{3,3}-free graphs

lemmas.name: fractional_duality
lemmas.statement: theorem fractional_duality (G : SimpleGraph V) : fractionalCoveringNumber G = fractionalPackingNumber G
lemmas.english: The fractional triangle covering number equals the fractional triangle packing number
lemmas.why_trust: Standard LP duality argument, well-established in literature
lemmas.needs_validation: Need to verify fractional definitions match paper exactly
implications: Tuza conjecture is equivalent to: integrality gap <= 2

lemmas.name: covering_packing_chain
lemmas.statement: lemma covering_packing_chain (G : SimpleGraph V) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≥ fractionalCoveringNumber G ∧ fractionalCoveringNumber G = fractionalPackingNumber G ∧ fractionalPackingNumber G ≥ trianglePackingNumber G
lemmas.proof_technique: Integer solutions are feasible for relaxation

lemmas.name: tuza_K33_free
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_K33_free (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : ¬hasK33Subdivision G) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 2 * trianglePackingNumber G
lemmas.english: Graphs with no K_{3,3} subdivision satisfy Tuza

key_insight: Fractional version is ALWAYS tight (tau* = nu*). The real question is bounding the integrality gap.
notes: Need to formalize fractional packing/covering definitions before these can be used
